snippet: People on both sides of the negotiations say it is doubtful a deal can be completed in time to use regular officials for Week 1.
abstract: NFL notifies teams that the league is closing in on a deal to end the lockout of officials but negotiations broke off after a brief meeting in which officials made clear that retirement benefits remained the key sticking point; it appears doubtful that an agreement can be worked out for officials to return by Week 1 of the regular season.
lead_paragraph: People on both sides of the negotiations say it is doubtful a deal can be completed in time to use regular officials for Week 1.

headline.seo: N.F.L. and Officials Still at Odds on Retirement Benefits
headline.main: N.F.L. and Officials Still at Odds
headline.print_headline: N.F.L. and Officials Still at Odds
